items.title: These States Are Debating Castration for Sex Crimes. Experts Call It Cruel and Pointless.
items.description: Critics say there’s no evidence that castration prevents future sex offenses. Yet several states are weighing such measures.

items.title: He Spent Years in Federal Prisons. Now He’s Helping to Lead Them.
items.description: The Bureau of Prisons’ new deputy director’s past incarceration has drawn outrage from some officers — and support from people still inside.

items.title: A North Carolina County Wanted New Court to Stem Its Opioid Crisis. Then Came Trump’s Cuts.
items.description: As the Justice Department slashes funding to programs across the U.S., Wilkes County’s planned recovery court was halted before it started.

items.title: Have We Been Wrong About ‘Psychopaths’?
items.description: In a new book, Rasmus Rosenberg Larsen questions how courts and prisons use psychopathy diagnoses — and whether they should at all.

items.title: The Feds Are Offering Migrants Cash to Self-Deport. Lawyers Call These Incentives Misleading.
items.description: The government’s offer to pay a stipend, waive fees, and let people return legally to the U.S. go against current law and court practices, immigration...
